annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Today's referee Markus Schmidt rightly decides to book Aleksandar Ignjovski (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his harsh tackle.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) times his run too early and the linesman raises his flag for offside.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) has a great chance inside the box and rams the ball inside the right post.

annotations.label: attendance
annotations.description: The attendance for today's match is 75000.
The goalkeeper is not tested by the free kick from 24 metres out by Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) as his effort only hit the wall.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Philipp Lahm trots off the pitch and is replaced by Gianluca Gaudino (Bayern Munich).
Markus Schmidt blows his whistle for a foul after Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) hacks down one of his opponents. Bayern Munich are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels low towards the middle of the target, but Kevin Trapp easily deals with the threat.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Bayern Munich will take a corner kick. Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) takes the corner with a short pass.

OFF THE POST! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Referee Markus Schmidt sees the trip by Takashi Inui (Eintracht Frankfurt) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle.
The Bayern Munich players are exchanging some short passes.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Substitution. Sebastian Rode (Bayern Munich) in, Thiago Alcantara out.
Markus Schmidt blows his whistle. Rafinha (Bayern Munich) commits a foul after dangerous play.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) uses bad language while talking to the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) blows a good chance to score. He collects a pass inside the box, but his effort to the middle of the goal is brilliantly blocked. Great defending!
Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) is unable to feed an accurate cross into the box.
Nelson Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header wasn't accurate at all and the ball went well wide of the right post.
Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) blows a big chance! He quickly whipped the ball from inside the box towards the net to beat the keeper, but his effort crashes against the left post.
Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) serves up a nice cross, but the defence clears the danger.
Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) is disappointed with himself because he got into a good area but produced a poor cross. Pepe Reina (Bayern Munich) is about to take a goal kick.
The ball spins up and hits the hand of Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) after he fails to control it and the referee blows his whistle for a foul.
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) sends a cross into the box, but the opposition's defence clears the ball to safety.
A spell of possession for Bayern Munich in an attempt to control the game.
Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) swings in a cross, but the ball is cleared to safety by one of the defending players.
Good movement by Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt), but he can't find any of his teammates as the cross is poor.
A pass from Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) is intercepted by Kevin Trapp and the move breaks down.
A rebound falls at the feet of Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) who unleashes a shot from long range towards the goal. However, his effort is poor and it flies high over the crossbar.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) whips in the corner, but one of the defending players gets a head on it and intercepts.

Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) attempts to find his teammate with a pass from outside the box, but the opposition's defence is quick to react and thwarts the attack. The linesman points to the corner flag, Bayern Munich are going to take it.
Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) sends a lofted cross into the penalty area. Unfortunately for him, the opponent's defence deals with his cross comfortably and intercepts it.
Nelson Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and immediately unleashes a shot towards goal, but it goes high over the crossbar.
A poor finish by Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) as he misdirects his shot well wide of the right post.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

There was certainly plenty of action during that opening 45 minutes. The hosts are enjoying a clear advantage over the opposition. The home team tries to prevail using combination football, while the away team adopt a defensive style of play.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The match has reached half time.

annotations.label: injury
annotations.description: Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) is asking for medical treatment after picking up an injury.

annotations.label: time
annotations.description: Fourth official shows 1 min. of added time.
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) commits a foul after unfairly battling his opponent for the ball.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) gets on the ball and beats an opponent, but his run is stopped by the referee Markus Schmidt who sees an offensive foul.
The game is interrupted as Nelson Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt) is flagged offside.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.

Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt) unleashes a promising shot low towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Pepe Reina thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
Flag goes up against Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) and the referee blows his whistle for offside. The referee blows his whistle for offside.
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, but it is straight at Kevin Trapp.
Bamba Anderson (Eintracht Frankfurt) clearly handles the ball, but he is surprised when the referee blows his whistle. Bayern Munich win a free kick.
Close! Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) takes the resultant free kick from 25 metres out and his shot goes just over the crossbar.
The referee blows his whistle as Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) was too aggressive in his challenge. Bayern Munich earn a free kick which could lead to a goal scoring opportunity.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: The foul by Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Markus Schmidt.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) reacts well near the penalty spot to connect with the resulting corner, but fails to direct his header into the back of the net. The ball goes well wide of the left post.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) looks like he will be the one to take the corner kick.
Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) sends the ball into the box from the side of the pitch, but his cross is blocked. Corner kick. Bayern Munich will have an opportunity.

This was a piece of cake for Kevin Trapp. Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) plays in a hopeful cross, but it doesn't find its way to any of the attacking players. The ball goes out of play and Eintracht Frankfurt will have a goal kick.
The Bayern Munich players keep the ball and are exchanging a combination of passes. They are waiting for gaps in the defence to open up.
Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) crosses into the box from near the side line, but he doesn't connect as he wanted and it's cleared by the well organized defence.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) misses a big opportunity after striking the ball towards the middle of the goal and the goalkeeper makes an easy save.
Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) sends a cross into the box, but the opposition's defence quickly intercepts the ball.
Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) tries to slide the ball through to a teammate but it's well blocked by a defender.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) tries his luck with a long range effort after receiving a precise pass. It goes to the bottom right corner, but Kevin Trapp has a clear view of it and makes a comfortable save.
Pepe Reina steps in and intercepts a long pass from Sonny Kittel (Eintracht Frankfurt).
What a sweet touch by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Kevin Trapp to hold.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) tries to take the opposition by surprise with a quick free kick into the box.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) gives away a foul for a clumsy challenge. Referee Markus Schmidt saw the whole situation. Bayern Munich have a free kick.

Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) sends the ball into the penalty area from a free kick a few yards outside the box. The cross is good, but the goalkeeper shows himself in a good light as he leaps high to intercept the ball.
Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes a rough challenge, and the referee blows for a foul. A free kick to Bayern Munich.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has a shot from the edge of the box which goes past the goalkeeper and into the back of the net. Thomas Muller provided the assistance with a headed pass. 1:0.
Nelson Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt) is forced to stop his attacking move after the linesman signals for offside.
A pass by Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) ends up in no man's land, and the attacking effort comes to an end.
Dangerous play by Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt). Markus Schmidt blows his whistle for a foul.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) meets a fine cross inside the penalty area from the resulting free kick and attempts to beat the keeper with a sweet header. That he does, but one of the defenders standing on the goal line manages to stop the effort going into the middle of the target.
Haris Seferovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) brings an opponent down and Markus Schmidt interrupts the game. Bayern Munich have a free kick.
Nelson Valdez (Eintracht Frankfurt) is able to continue to play.
The defence is alert as they clear a dangerous cross from Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Markus Schmidt blows his whistle and signals a foul after Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) brought his opponent down.
